name: Space Jill
description: Space Jill by TGA Genetics is a recreation of the famed Space Queen hybrid, which crossed Romulan with Cinderella 99. This F2 reincarnation captures the sweet mango and candy aroma remembered by fans of the original Space Queen. Space Jill, a 70% sativa strain, induces a high-energy buzz conducive to productivity, but too much can leave the unaccustomed user paranoid.
descriptionPlain: Space Jill by TGA Genetics is a recreation of the famed Space Queen hybrid, which crossed Romulan with Cinderella 99. This F2 reincarnation captures the sweet mango and candy aroma remembered by fans of the original Space Queen. Space Jill, a 70% sativa strain, induces a high-energy buzz conducive to productivity, but too much can leave the unaccustomed user paranoid.

highlightedReviews.text:
I decided to test this strain out on stress-induced migraines. My back was already hurting from doing some yardwork during the day (and I knew it works on pain), so I decided that the next time I started having a migraine, I would smoke some.

Well, today was the day to test it. One of My acquaintances refused to be civil in a conversation, which raised My stress level to the point of causing a migraine. I went outside, had a little smoke, and within moments, My migraine pains were mellowed out (as were the rest of My pains).

Now, if I were to take prescription medications for this, I would have to take one for My back, one for My leg, one for My head, one for My stomach, and another couple for the side effects caused by taking so many pills. This way, I smoke a bit, and lean back, maybe use some eye drops, drink some liquid refreshments, and I'm good.

This strain doesn't really give Me the desire to eat anything. I just want to drink something cold, and work on writing reviews or some arts and crafts or something. And I definitely do not want to deal with drama when I use this strain.

That, I like.

Space Jill has become a favorite strain simply for its uplifting effects.  There is no trace of sleepy couch lock with this one.  It comes on slow and turns into an energetic and talkative high that I've found in few other strains.  Maybe not for everyone but this sativa does wonders for my ADD and productivity.

articles.title: The Best Cannabis Strains for the Holidays (According to Leafly Reviewers)
articles.author: Brett Konen
articles.text:
The holidays are fast approaching, so naturally you’re thinking about the perfect cannabis strains to enjoy over the upcoming weeks. Have innumerable aunts, uncles, in-laws, and second cousins coming into town for the long weekend? You’ll probably need something to chill you out after all that family time. Wanting to keep moving in spite of the weather? You’re after something active. Have about a thousand errands left to run? Something to spice up the process would be nice.
Luckily, Leafly user reviews are a gold mine of suggestions for cannabis strains that fit any scenario, so we’ve compiled a few great user-sourced recommendations for a range of seasonal activities listed below. Whether you’re grocery shopping, cocoa-sipping, or baking some cannabis-infused holiday cookies, try out one of the ideas below and enjoy your holiday celebrations!

For Coping with Winter
  “This is the perfect strain to make Seattle winter days productive! A couple hits gives my ambition, creativity and libido a jump-start.” –munin.raven
 
 “My go to for getting my figure back after holiday indulgence!” –grngrazer
 
 “Smooth pull, great taste – exactly what I hoped for…real killer high to cure the inevitable holiday blues.” –hazedandconfused
For Spending Time with Family & Friends
 “Smells like Christmas trees, tastes like pine and lightens the heart and mind…I found it made the whole holiday with ALL the family, very enjoyable. Oh and added benefits of not breaking ornaments or dropping the turkey.” –Free_Byrd
 
 “Smoked this with my Nana and great Uncle Pete while on winter vacation…Made me forget how much my back hurt from sleeping on an air mattress.” –somniumtextrix
 
 “A swift cerebral head high, accompanied by a punch of energy. Best used at a party with friends as is very good for getting you in the mood, to talk, dance, whatever!” –JustAnotherStoner
For Curling Up by the Fire
 “I could feel every atom in my body float away in rhythm with the space heater I was sitting next to. Perfect for sitting home on a cold winter evening and then getting a good night sleep.” –Anonymous
 
 “I enjoyed a blunt and hits from my vaporizer along side with a cup of hot chocolate, it was a great combo…pick it up for a stay-at-home type of day.” –kushconnoisseur420
 
 “I’m washing it down with some seasonal ale and it’s the perfect end to a perfect night.” –BudseyXO
Looks, Smells, and Tastes Like Christmas
 “When I opened the bag I thought I was suddenly on a camping trip. It smelled like a Christmas tree…The taste of pine, clove and earth danced across across my palate.” –robmacpheejr
 
 “Nom nom nom like a Christmas tree with a lifesaver candy cane in your mouth.” –greedyguy
 
 “Feels like I threw a Christmas tree in a wood chipper… lights, ornaments, candy canes – everything – and put it in my Pax to vape it.’” –Midnyte003
For Making Spirits Bright
 “This is like that one ‘big’ present hidden behind the tree just when you think you didn’t get what you ‘really’ wanted that year. It’s that good.” –Anonymous
 
 “My brain lit up like Times Square on New Years Eve.” –Grumple
 
 “This strain had me smiling like the Grinch that stole Christmas.” –Skyclub
 
 “Like skating across a frozen lake surrounded by snowflakes in the night.” – bugpowderdustmugwumpjism
 
 “BEST. STRAIN. EVER. Four for you, Sour D, you go Sour D.” –Anonymous
What are some of your favorite strains to enjoy over the holidays? Share in the comments!

articles.title: New Strains Alert: Frankenstein, Lavender Jones, Purple Paralysis, Space Jill, and Sugar Kush
articles.author: Kayla Williams
articles.text:
Based on submissions made by Leafly users, we've added Frankenstein, Lavender Jones, Purple Paralysis, Space Jill, and Sugar Kush to the Leafly Explorer. Keep 'em coming! Also, we've got plently more new strains on the way, so stay tuned. In the meantime, leave a strain review if you've had the chance to try any of these new varieties, and let us know which strains you'd love for us to add next so we can make sure we don't forget any of your favorites!
1. Frankenstein
Characteristics of Frankenstein:

80% indica
Unknown lineage
Recommended for consumers with a high cannabis tolerance or patients with severe symptoms
Genetics gave rise to Opal OG Kush, Copper Kush, Sweet Lafayette, and OG's Pearl

2. Lavender Jones
Characteristics of Lavender Jones:

Hybrid strain
Cross between Casey Jones and Purple Urkle
Buds express themselves in vibrant hues of purple and green
Can bring deep relaxation paired with dreamy cerebral euphoria
Indoor flowering time of 7 to 8 weeks

3. Purple Paralysis
Characteristics of Purple Paralysis:

Sativa-dominant hybrid
Also known as Jellyfish Bud
Cross between Power Plant and Lavender
Breeder: Cream of the Crop
Hashy lavender aroma
Has potently energizing effects
Indoor flowering time of about 67 days

4. Space Jill
Characteristics of Space Jill:

70% sativa strain
Cross between Romulan and Cinderella 99
Recreation of the Space Queen strain
Breeder: TGA Genetics
Sweet mango and candy aroma
Can bring high-energy, creative, productive effects

5. Sugar Kush
Characteristics of Sugar Kush:

Indica-dominant strain
Cross between Kandy Kush and Hash Plant
Indoor flowering time of 9 weeks
